Create a sheet of alliances with customized columns
See <https://github.com/xdnw/locutus/wiki/nation_placeholders> for a list of placeholders

nations.name: nations
nations.desc: The nations to include in each alliance

columns.name: columns
columns.desc: The columns to use in the sheet

revenue.desc:
Get the revenue of nations or alliances
Equilibrium taxrate is where the value of raws consumed matches the value taxed

includeUntaxable.name: includeUntaxable
includeUntaxable.desc: Include the revenue of nations unable to be taxed

includeWarCosts.name: includeWarCosts
includeWarCosts.desc:
The amount of time to use to add average DAILY war cost
This includes raid profit

markasoffshore.desc:
Mark an alliance as the offshore of another
This is solely for informational purposes such as when displaying an alliance's info or militarization

edit.desc:
Edit an attribute of your in-game alliance
Attributes match the in-game fields and are case sensitive
Run the command without arguments to get a list of attributes

departures.desc: List the alliance rank changes of a nation or alliance members

ignoreMembers.name: ignoreMembers
ignoreMembers.desc: Ignore nations currently a member of an alliance

listIds.name: listIds
listIds.desc: Attach a list of all nation ids found

cost.desc: Get the value of nations including their cities, projects and units

activity_date.desc:
Generate a sheet of nation login activity from a nation id over a timeframe
The sheet columns are the dates with the values being either 1 or 0 for logging in or not

declares_date.desc:
Generate a sheet of per nation war declare activity over a timeframe
The columns represent the time unit (either turns or days) when wars are declared for each nation

deposits_date.desc:
Generate a sheet of per nation bank deposit/withdraw activity over a timeframe
The columns represent the time unit (either turns or days) when bank transfers occur for each nation
A positive value represents a deposit, a negative value represents a withdrawal
When both are specified, the net deposit/withdrawal is shown

daychange.desc:
Generate a sheet of nations and their day change
Nations not in an alliance registered to this guild can only show the public day change estimate based on unit purchases

nationsheet.desc:
A sheet of nations stats with customizable columns
See <https://github.com/xdnw/locutus/wiki/nation_placeholders> for a list of placeholders

columns.name: columns

alliancesheet.desc:
Create a sheet of alliances with customized columns
See <https://github.com/xdnw/locutus/wiki/nation_placeholders> for a list of placeholders

nations.name: nations
nations.desc: The nations to include in each alliance

columns.name: columns
columns.desc: The columns to use in the sheet

activitysheetfromid.desc:
Generate a sheet of nation login activity from a nation id over a timeframe
The columns are the 7 days of the week and then turns of the day (12)
Note: use the other activity sheet need info of a deleted nation
Days represent the % of that day a nation logs in (UTC)
Numbers represent the % of that turn a nation logs in

activitysheet.desc:
Generate a sheet of nation login activity from a nation id over a timeframe
The columns are the 7 days of the week and then turns of the day (12)
Days represent the % of that day a nation logs in (UTC)
Numbers represent the % of that turn a nation logs in

subscribe.desc: Switch a channel to a subscription channel in multiple servers

unset.desc: Bulk unset a guild setting in multiple servers which are invalid based on the provided options

trade.desc: Force a fetch and update of trades from the api

syncinterviews.desc: Force an update of all interview channels and print the results

offshore.desc: Force a fetch and update of banks from the api

Returns a list of forum profiles and their respective nation id / discord tag
Deprecated because it is an unauthenticated list, anyone can set their discord or nation on the forums
Information purposes only

discord.desc:
Pull registered nations from locutus
(or a provided url)

attacks.desc: Force a fetch and update of attacks from the api

uid.desc: Force a fetch and update of uids from the api

taxes.desc: Force a fetch and update of taxes from the api

alliance.name: alliance
alliance.desc: Specify other alliances, instead of the ones registered to this guild

Update using values in a spreadsheet
Deprecated, use the api instead (i.e. no arguments)

legacy_deprecated.name: legacy_deprecated

user.desc: Run a command as another user

nations.desc: Run a command as multiple nations

importemoji.desc: Import all emojis from another guild

trade_id.desc: View info about trades with a given id

nation_meta.desc: View meta information about a nation in the bot's database

guild.desc: View info about a guild with a given id

format_for_nations.desc: Format a command for each nation, and run it as yourself

Remove deleted alliances or guilds from a coalition
Note: Do not remove deleted offshores or banks if you want to use their previous transactions in deposit calculations

test_auto.desc: View and test that the current automatic beige alert settings allow for notification

setbeigealertscoreleeway.desc: Allow receiving automatic beige alerts a certain nation score below your current war range

beigealertrequiredstatus.desc:
Only get the automatic beige alerts if you have the online status on discord
Note: You will still receive alerts for targets you have subscribed to via `/alerts beige beigereminders`

beigealertrequiredloot.desc:
Set the required amount of loot for automatic beige alerts
Defaults to $15m

requiredLoot.name: requiredLoot
requiredLoot.desc:
Require the target to have at least this much estimated loot
Resources are valued at weekly market average prices

beigealert.desc: Set a reminder for when a nation leaves beige or VM

requiredLoot.name: requiredLoot
requiredLoot.desc:
Require targets to have at least this much loot
Resources are valued at weekly market average prices

allowOutOfScore.name: allowOutOfScore
allowOutOfScore.desc: Allow targets this much ns below your score range

min_value.desc:
Set the required transfer market value required for automatic bank alerts
Defaults to $100m, minimum value of 100m

requiredValue.name: requiredValue
requiredValue.desc:
Require the bank transfer to be worth this much
Resources are valued at weekly market average prices

unsubscribe.desc: Remove your subscriptions to large bank transfers

subscribe.desc:
Get an alert when a nation or alliance sends a large bank transfer
Use `*` to subscribe to all nations

list.desc: List your subscriptions to large bank transfers

undercut.desc: Create an alert when a top offer you have in-game is undercut by another nation

price.desc: Create an alert when an in-game trade for a resource at an absolute price point

no_offers.desc: Create an alert when there are no standing offers for resources in-game

mistrade.desc: Create an alert when an in-game trade for a resource is past the top price point of the opposite buy or sell offer

margin.desc: Create an alert for specific differences between buy and sell prices for in-game resource trades

login.desc:
Get an alert on discord when a target logs in within the next 5 days
Useful if you want to know when they might defeat you in war or perform an attack

vm.desc: Get the VM history of a set of nations

gray_streak.desc: Get the inactivity streak of a set of nations over a specified timeframe

Get detailed information about a nation
Nation argument can be nation name, id, link, or discord tag
e.g. `/who @borg`

`safety` defaults to what has the best net. Options: quick, normal, covert

multi.desc:
Check if a nation shares networks with others
Notes:
- Sharing networks does not mean they are the same person (mobile networks, schools, public wifi, vpns, dynamic ips
- A network not shared 'concurrently' or within a short timeframe may be a false positive
- Having many networks, but only a few shared may be a sign of a VPN being used (there are legitimate reasons for using a VPN)
- It is against game rules to use evidence to threaten or coerce others
See: https://politicsandwar.com/rules/

blitzsheet.desc:
Generates a a blitz sheet
A blitz sheet contains a list of defenders (left column) and auto assigns attackers (right columns)
Note: If the blitz sheet generated has a lot of city updeclares or unslotted enemies it is recommended to go through and remove low priority defenders
- Low priority could be enemies without a recent offensive war, inactive, low military, or poor activity
- Example defNations: `~enemies,#position>1,#active_m<4880,#dayssincelastoffensive>200,#dayssince3consecutivelogins>120,#aircraftpct<0.8,#tankpct<=0.6`Note: To avoid updeclares enable `onlyEasyTargets`

defNations.name: defNations

request.desc:

cancelrequest.desc: Cancel your requests to have your blockades broken

roi.desc: Calculate how many days it takes to ROI on the last 50 land for a specified level

cost.desc: Calculate the costs of purchasing land (from current to max)

roi.desc: Calculate how many days it takes to ROI on the last improvement slot for a specified infra level

cost.desc: Calculate the costs of purchasing infra (from current to max)

add_rule.desc:
Configure the guilds and conflict ids that will be featured by this guild
By default all conflicts are featured
Specify either a set of conflicts, or a guild to feature all conflicts from that guild

remove_rule.desc:
Configure the guilds and conflict ids that will be featured by this guild
By default all conflicts are featured
Specify either a set of conflicts, or a guild to feature all conflicts from that guild

list_rules.desc:
List the ruleset for which conflicts are featured by this guild (if any are set)
This consists of a list of either guilds that created the conflict, or individual conflicts

list.desc: Get a list of the conflicts in the database

create_temp.desc:
Create a temporary conflict between two coalitions
Conflict is not auto updated

delete.desc:
Delete a conflict from the database
Does not push changes to the website

create.desc:
Manually create an ongoing conflict between two coalitions
Use `-1` for end date to specify no end date

featured.desc: Purge permenent conflicts that aren't in the database

user_generated.desc: Purge permenent conflicts on the website that aren't in the database

add_forum_post.desc: Purge permenent conflicts that aren't in the database

end.desc:
Set the end date for a conflict
Use a value of `-1` to specify no end date
This does not push the data to the site

alliance.name: alliance
alliance.desc: Only set the end date for a single alliance

start.desc:
Set the start date for a conflict
Use a value of `-1` to specify no start date (if prividing an alliance)
This does not push the data to the site

rename.desc: Set the name of a conflict, or the name of a conflict's coalition

wiki.desc: Sets the wiki page for a conflict

status.desc: Sets the wiki page for a conflict

casus_belli.desc: Sets the wiki page for a conflict

category.desc: Sets the wiki page for a conflict

website.desc: Pushes conflict data to the AWS bucket for the website

multiple_sources.desc:
Bulk import conflict data from multiple sources

This does not push the data to the site unless `all` is used

ctowned.desc:
Import ctowned conflicts into the database
This does not push the data to the site

useCache.name: useCache
useCache.desc: If the cached version of the site is used

wiki_page.desc:
Import a wiki page as a conflict
This does not push the data to the site

name.name: name
name.desc: The name of the wiki page

url.name: url
url.desc: The url of the wiki page

wiki_all.desc:
Import all wiki pages as conflicts
This does not push the data to the site

recalculate_graphs.desc:
Recalculate the graph data for a set of conflicts
This does not push the data to the site

recalculate_tables.desc:
Recalculate the table data for a set of conflicts
This does not push the data to the site

alliance_names.desc:
Import alliance names (to match with the ids of deleted alliances)
This does not push the data to the site

db_file.desc:
Import from an external database file
Requires a restart of the bot to complete the import

remove.desc:
Remove a set of alliances from a conflict

add.desc:
Add a set of alliances to a conflict
This does NOT update conflict stats

strengthtiergraph.desc:
Generate a graph of nation military strength by score between two coalitions
1 tank = 1/32 aircraft for strength calculations
Effective score range is limited to 1.75x with a linear reduction of strength up to 40% to account for up-declares

col1MMR.name: col1MMR
col1MMR.desc: Use the score/strength of coalition 1 nations at specific military unit levels

col2MMR.name: col2MMR
col2MMR.desc: Use the score/strength of coalition 2 nations at specific military unit levels

col1Infra.name: col1Infra
col1Infra.desc: Use the score of coalition 1 nations at specific average infrastructure levels

col2Infra.name: col2Infra
col2Infra.desc: Use the score of coalition 2 nations at specific average infrastructure levels

spytiergraph.desc:
Generate a graph of spy counts by city count between two coalitions

total.desc: Graph the total spies instead of average per nation

scoretiergraph.desc: Generate a graph of nation counts by score between two coalitions

mmrtiergraph.desc: Generate a graph of nation military levels by city count between two coalitions

buildings.name: buildings
buildings.desc: Graph the average military buildings instead of units

total.desc: Compare the sum of each nation's attribute in the coalition instead of average

joke.desc: Get a random joke from the joke file

Set `repeat: True` to repeat the watermark down the entire image

Allow creating an invite when any nation matches `sendTo`, when they don't already have an invite, or theirs has expired

Defaults to false

replacements.desc:

You can use \n for newline for discord slash commands

requiredDepth.name: requiredDepth

seed.desc: Variation seed. The same seed will produce the same variations, otherwise results are random

By default only roles will be added, specify `removeRoles` to remove roles from users not assigned the role in the sheet
Specify `listMissing` to list nations that are not assigned a role in the sheet
Columns:
- `nation`, `leader`, `user`, `member` (at least one)
- `role`, `role1`, `roleN` (multiple, or use comma separated values in one cell)

Clear the bot managed alliance roles on discord
UNUSED: `Alliance name roles which have no members`
ALLIANCE: `All alliance name roles`
DELETED_ALLIANCES: `Alliance name roles with no valid in-game alliance`
INACTIVE_ALLIANCES: `Alliance name roles with no active members`
NOT_ALLOW_LISTED: `Alliance name roles not in the allow list (defined by settings:`AUTOROLE_ALLIANCES,AUTOROLE_TOP_X` and coalition:`MASKEDALLIANCES``
NON_MEMBERS: `Users who are not in the alliance in-game`
NON_ALLIES: `Users who are not in the alliance, or the `allies` / `offshore` coalition in-game`

The audits to include in the sheet

The audits to exclude from the sheet

Get a sheet with member nations and their deposits
Each nation's safekeep should match the total balance given by deposits commandAdd `-b` to 
Add `-o` to not include any manual deposit offsets
Add `-d` to not include deposits
Add `-t` to not include taxes
Add `-l` to not include loans
Add `-g` to not include grants
Add `-p` to include past depositors
Add `-f` to force an update

addrequiredinternaltaxrate.desc:
This setting maps nation filters to internal tax rate for bulk automation.
To list nations current rates: </tax listbracketauto:1015168434906071119>
To bulk move nations: </nation set taxinternalauto:1015168434776051733>
Tax rate is in the form: `money/rss`
In the form: 
```
#cities<10:100/100
#cities>=10:25/25
```
All nation filters are supported (e.g. roles)
Priority is first to last (so put defaults at the bottom)

addrequiredbracket.desc:
This setting maps nation filters to tax bracket for bulk automation.
To list nations current rates: </tax listbracketauto:1015168434906071119>
To bulk move nations: </nation set taxbracketauto:1015168434776051733>
In the form: 
```
#cities<10:1234
#cities>=10:2345
```
All nation filters are supported (e.g. roles)
Priority is first to last (so put defaults at the bottom)

tax_base.desc:
The internal tax amount ($/rss) in the format e.g. `25/25` to be excluded in deposits.
Defaults to `100/100` (i.e. no taxes are included in depos).
Setting is retroactive. See also: </nation set taxinternal:1015168434776051733>

required_tax_bracket.desc:
This setting maps nation filters to tax bracket for bulk automation.
To list nations current rates: </tax listbracketauto:1015168434906071119>
To bulk move nations: </nation set taxbracketauto:1015168434776051733>
In the form: 
```
#cities<10:1234
#cities>=10:2345
```
All nation filters are supported (e.g. roles)
Priority is first to last (so put defaults at the bottom)

required_internal_taxrate.desc:
This setting maps nation filters to internal tax rate for bulk automation.
To list nations current rates: </tax listbracketauto:1015168434906071119>
To bulk move nations: </nation set taxinternalauto:1015168434776051733>
Tax rate is in the form: `money/rss`
In the form: 
```
#cities<10:100/100
#cities>=10:25/25
```
All nation filters are supported (e.g. roles)
Priority is first to last (so put defaults at the bottom)

member_can_set_bracket.desc: Whether members can use </nation set taxbracket:1015168434776051733>

addconditionalrole.desc:
Auto assign roles based on conditions
See: <https://github.com/xdnw/locutus/wiki/nation_placeholders>
Accepts a list of filters to a role.
In the form:
```
#cities<10:@someRole
#cities>=10:@otherRole
```
Use `*` as the filter to match all nations.
Only alliance members can be given roles
Use </role autoassign:1015168434847363134> to auto assign

addassignablerole.desc: Map roles that can be assigned (or removed). See </self create:1015168434847363135> </role removeassignablerole:1015168434847363134> </self add:1015168434847363135> </self remove:1015168434847363135>

conditional_roles.desc:
Auto assign roles based on conditions
See: <https://github.com/xdnw/locutus/wiki/nation_placeholders>
Accepts a list of filters to a role.
In the form:
```
#cities<10:@someRole
#cities>=10:@otherRole
```
Use `*` as the filter to match all nations.
Only alliance members can be given roles
Use </role autoassign:1015168434847363134> to auto assign

autorole_top_x.desc:
The number of top alliances to provide roles for, defaults to `0`
Alliances added to `MASKEDALLIANCES: `Additional alliances to mask with `/role autoassign` (if alliance masking is enabled)`` are still included outside this range

autorole_member_apps.desc:
Whether member and applicant roles are automatically added or removed.
Note: Set `WAR_ALERT_FOR_OFFSHORES` to false to not give member roles to offshore nations
Cannot be used in conjuction with `AUTOROLE_ALLY_GOV`

autorole_ally_roles.desc:
List of roles to autorole from ally servers
(this is intended for coalition servers to give gov roles to allies)

autorole_ally_gov.desc: Whether to give gov/member roles to allies (this is intended for coalition servers), `true` or `false`

autorole_alliances.desc:
Options: { FALSE,ALL,ALLIES }
See also:
- `/coalition create coalitionname: MASKEDALLIANCES`
- </role clearallianceroles:1015168434847363134>
- </settings_role autorole_alliance_rank:1104571317719670888>
- </settings_role autorole_member_apps:1104571317719670888>
- </settings_role autorole_top_x:1104571317719670888>

assignable_roles.desc: Map roles that can be assigned (or removed). See </self create:1015168434847363135> </role removeassignablerole:1015168434847363134> </self add:1015168434847363135> </self remove:1015168434847363135>

reward_referral.desc: The reward (resources) for referring a nation in the form `{food=1,money=3.2}`

reward_mentor.desc: The reward (resources) for mentoring a nation in the form `{food=1,money=3.2}`

remove_timed_message.desc: Remove a timed message with a specific time-delay for a trigger

trigger.name: trigger
trigger.desc:
The type of message to remove
The default type is `CREATION`

timeDelay.name: timeDelay
timeDelay.desc: The time delay of the message to remove

add_timed_message.desc:
Add a timed message to be sent to new members after a delay
- CREATION
 - When a nation is created
 - Messages will not send to nations that are inactive, or created before the message was created
- MEMBER_DEPARTURE
 - When an applicant or member (but not officer) leaves an alliance
 - Messages will not send if another message has been sent recently, if the nation is inactive, or it was created recently
- GRAVEYARD_ACTIVE
 - When a nation not part of a functioning alliance becomes active
 - Nations must be inactive for at least the time specified to be sent the custom messageMessages will not send if another message has been sent recently

Note: If multiple messages qualify, only the last one will be sent. This task runs every 5 minutes

recruit_message_subject.desc:
The recruit message subject
Must also set </settings_recruit recruit_message_content:1104571317719670892>

recruit_message_output.desc: The #channel to receive recruitment message output

recruit_message_delay.desc: The amount of time to delay recruitment messages by

recruit_message_content.desc:
The recruit message body
Must also set </settings_recruit recruit_message_output:1104571317719670892>

vm_alert_channel.desc: The #channel to receive alerts when a nation goes into VM

reroll_alert_channel.desc: The #channel to receive alerts for nation rerolls

report_alert_channel.desc:
The channel to receive alerts when any nation or user is reported to the bot
See </report add:1141362798606176256>

orbis_officer_mmr_change_alerts.desc: The #channel to receive alerts when gov members increase MMR (top 80)

orbis_officer_leave_alerts.desc: The #channel to receive alerts when officers leave an alliance  (top 50)

orbis_leader_change_alert.desc: The #channel to receive alerts when a nation is promoted to leader in an alliance (top 80)

orbis_alliance_exodus_alerts.desc:
The #channel to receive alerts when multiple 5+ members leave an alliance
See also: </settings_orbis_alerts alliance_exodus_top_x:1104571317719670894>

escalation_alerts.desc: The #channel to receive alerts for war escalation alerts in orbis

deletion_alert_channel.desc: The channel to receive alerts when any nation in the game deletes

ban_alert_channel.desc: The channel to receive alerts when any nation in the game is banned)

alliance_exodus_top_x.desc: The rank threshold to post exodus alerts for

activity_alerts.desc: The #channel to receive alerts for activity (e.g. pre blitz)

aa_ground_unit_alerts.desc:
The channel to send alerts when alliance ground units increase by more than 2.5%
See also setting `AA_GROUND_TOP_X` and coalition: `GROUND_ALERTS` and role alias: `GROUND_MILITARIZE_ALERT`

aa_ground_top_x.desc: Only do alliance ground unit alerts for the top X alliances (by active member score)

interview_pending_alerts.desc: The channel to receive alerts when a member requests an interview

interview_info_spam.desc: The channel to receive info spam about expired interview channels

archive_category.desc: The name or id of the CATEGORY you would like </channel close current:1015168434847363133> to move channels to

treaty_alerts.desc: The #channel to receive alerts for treaty changes

fa_server.desc: The guild to defer coalitions to

embassy_category.desc: The name or id of the CATEGORY you would like embassy channels created in (for </embassy:1015170851873763338>)

do_not_raid_top_x.desc:
The number of top alliances to include in the Do Not Raid (DNR) list
Members are not permitted to declare on members of these alliances or their direct allies
Results in the DNR will be excluded from commands, and will alert Foreign Affairs if violated
Defaults to `0`

alliance_create_alerts.desc: The #channel to receive alerts for alliance creation

registerapikey.desc:
API key found at the bottom of: <https://politicsandwar.com/account/>
Be sure to enable all access you wish the bot to have, and have a sufficient position in-game (e.g. leader)
Needed for alliance functions and information access, such as calculating resource dispersal, sending mail
![Api Key Example](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/672310912090243092/1143703860481904691/AAAetVInX_AQsRH_PbhSwx7dANRzZ31ykmtLfBdS0-paNiZN1xt36VWmClVeuhc4FwlpP7gaeNGk_jrfV24mgYUyz3AxTPY6ljLZZKGn1YkE_6vbRztKs512.png)

hide_legacy_notice.desc: If the notice about legacy message commands is hidden in the server

delegate_server.desc: The guild to delegate unset settings to

treasure_alert_channel.desc: The channel to receive alerts when a treasure moves to another nation or is about to reset

bounty_alert_channel.desc: The channel to receive alerts when a bounty is placed

setbeigereasons.desc:
A list of city ranges to beige reasons that are permitted.
In the form:
```
c1-9:*
c10+:INACTIVE,VACATION_MODE,APPLICANT
```
 Options:
- VACATION_MODE: You can beige enemies in Vacation Mode
- NOT_AN_ENEMY: Non enemies are not subject to beige/cycle orders
- INACTIVE: Nations who are inactive (2 days)
- APPLICANT: Applicants aren't subject to beige/cycle orders
- UNDER_C10_SLOG: If the enemy has less than 10 cities
- OFFENSIVE_WAR: War is offensive
- ALREADY_BEIGE_STACKED: Enemies already with enough beige to rebuild (6 days)
- NO_ENEMY_OFFENSIVE_WARS: Enemies not declaring any offensive wars
- MISSILE_TURRET: Enemies with high number of missiles
- NUKE_TURRET: Enemies with high numbers of nukes
- NO_RECENT_WARS: Enemy is has not declared a war in the past 20 days
- NO_RECENT_3_CONSECUTIVE_LOGINS: Enemy has not had 3 consecutive logins in the past 120 days
- NO_RECENT_5_CONSECUTIVE_LOGINS: Enemy has not had 5 consecutive logins in the past 120 days
- INCORRECT_ENEMY_MMR: Enemy does not have 5 barracks/factories
- USELESS: Enemy has no recent wars and no recent consecutive logins OR incorrect MMR
- BEIGE_CYCLE: If the enemy does not have beige, and two other strong nations can sit them whilst beige. DO NOT BEIGE DEFENSIVE WARS
- BEIGE_CYCLE_4D: If the enemy does not have beige, and one other strong nation can sit them whilst beige for 4d. DO NOT BEIGE DEFENSIVE WARS
- BEIGE_CYCLE_1: If the enemy does not have beige, and one other strong nation can sit them whilst beige for 2d. DO NOT BEIGE DEFENSIVE WARS
- BLOCKADED: If you are being sat on/blockaded and need to restock on warchest
- LOW_RESISTANCE: Low resistance, at risk of getting beiged (use your best judgement)
- LOW_RESISTANCE_OFFENSIVE: Low resistance, at risk of getting beiged (use your best judgement)
- DO_NOT_RAID: Try to peace nations that are on the Do Not Raid list
- NO_REASON: 

Also set: </coalition create:1015168434906071114> with ENEMIES: `Enemies`

enemy_beiged_alert_violations.desc: The #channel to receive alerts when an enemy gets beiged (without reason)

enemy_beiged_alert.desc: The #channel to receive alerts when an enemy gets beiged

enemy_alert_filter.desc:
A filter for enemies to alert on when they leave beige
Defaults to `#active_m<7200` (active in the past 5 days)

enemy_alert_channel_mode.desc:
The mode for the enemy alert channel to determine what alerts are posted and who is pinged
Options:
- PING_USERS_IN_RANGE
- PING_ROLE_IN_RANGE
- PING_ROLE_ALL

enemy_alert_channel.desc:
The #channel to receive alerts when an enemy nation leaves beige
Requirements for receiving alerts:
- Must have the `BEIGE_ALERT` or `ENEMY_ALERT_OFFLINE` role
- Be in range (score)
- active in the past 24h- Have a free offensive war slot
- Have at least 70% of the target's military
- Are online, away, or DND on discord, or have the `ENEMY_ALERT_OFFLINE` role

beige_violation_mail.desc:
Whether to send a mail to the nation when a beige violation occurs
Default: False

beige_alert_channel.desc:
The #channel to receive alerts when a raid target leaves beige.
`/role setalias locutusrole: BEIGE_ALERT` must also be set and have members in range

withdraw_alert_channel.desc: The #channel to receive alerts when a nation requests a transfer

large_transfers_channel.desc: The #channel to receive alerts e.g. for custom `!BankAlerts`

grant_request_channel.desc: The #channel for users to request grants in. No additional functionality is added, you can setup a ticket bot or an embed there

display_itemized_deposits.desc: Whether members's deposits are displayed by default with a breakdown of each category (true/false)

display_condensed_deposits.desc: Display deposits in a condensed format

deposit_alert_channel.desc: The #channel to receive alerts when a nation makes a deposit (this will no longer reliably alert)

addbalance_alert_channel.desc: The #channel to receive alerts when there is a large tranfer in the game or a nation VMs with resources

togglegrants.desc: The id of the member you want to add to the blacklist

removeresourcechannel.desc:
The #channel for users to request resources in.
For multiple alliances, use the form:
```
#defaultChannel
alliance1:#channel
```

addresourcechannel.desc:
Set the resource withdrawal channel to the current channel
Do not specify an alliance to set the default withdraw channel

addgranttemplatelimit.desc:
The global grant template send limits for each role, limiting how much each granter can send per interval.
This applies in addition to any limits set in the individual template.
The ECON role overrides grant template limits. See: </role setalias:1015168434847363134>
The highest value for each resource will be usedFormat: `role_id:resource1,resource2,resource3`

withdraw_ignores_expire.desc: Whether members's withdraw limit ignores their expiring grants (true/false)

route_alliance_bank.desc: If true, all transfers from the offshore will send via the alliance bank

resource_conversion.desc:
If members can convert resources to cash.
This is done virtually in </deposits check:1015168434776051741>Resources are converted using market average
Use `#cash` as the note when depositing or transferring funds

public_offshoring.desc: Public offshores allow other alliances to see and register to use this alliance as an offshore without approval

non_aa_members_can_bank.desc: Whether nations which are not a member of the alliance ingame can use any configured banking functions, such as withdrawals

member_can_withdraw_wartime.desc: Whether members can withdraw during wartime (true/false)

member_can_withdraw.desc: Whether members can use </transfer resources:1015168434776051740> or !grant` to access their own funds (true/false)

member_can_escrow.desc: Whether members can use </escrow withdraw:1138347817786671145> to withdraw their escrowed funds

grant_limit_delay.desc: The timeframe the GRANT_TEMPLATE_LIMITS is for, which restricts max funds that a user can grant using templates over this timeframe.

default_offshore_account.desc: The default account to offshore into via </offshore send:1015168434847363132>

banker_withdraw_limit_interval.desc: The time period the withdraw limit applies to (defaults to 1 day)

banker_withdraw_limit.desc: The daily withdraw limit (from the offshore) of non admins

allow_unverified_banking.desc: Allow unregistered nations to withdraw via a web banking portal

addrequiredmmr.desc:
Set the required MMR based on nation criteria
See: <https://github.com/xdnw/locutus/wiki/nation_placeholders>
Accepts a list of filters to the required MMR.
In the form:
```
#cities<10:505X
#cities>=10:0250
```
Use `*` as the filter to match all nations.

warchest_per_city.desc: Amount of warchest to recommend per city in form `{steel=1234,aluminum=5678,gasoline=69,munitions=420}`

required_mmr.desc:
Set the required MMR based on nation criteria
See: <https://github.com/xdnw/locutus/wiki/nation_placeholders>
Accepts a list of filters to the required MMR.
In the form:
```
#cities<10:505X
#cities>=10:0250
```
Use `*` as the filter to match all nations.

member_rebuy_infra_alert.desc: The channel to receive alerts when a member buys infra

member_leave_alert_channel.desc: The channel to receive alerts when a member leaves

member_audit_alerts.desc: The #channel to ping members about audits

disabled_member_audits.desc:
A comma separated list of audit types to ignore:
{ GRAY,HIGH_INFRA,UNPROFITABLE_FARMS,UNEVEN_INFRA,WIND_POWER,WAR_TYPE_NOT_RAID,WAR_POLICY,INACTIVE }

register_openai_key.desc:
OpenAI API key
Used for chat responses and completion
Get a key from: <https://platform.openai.com/account/api-keys>

gpt_usage_limits.desc:
gpt user and guild usage limits, by turn and day
Used to limit costs incurred from excessive usageUsage is only tracked per session, and is reset each time the bot restarts

enable_github_copilot.desc:
Enable GitHub Copilot for generating AI text responses
See: <https://github.com/features/copilot>
This is an alternative to an open ai key

sheets.desc: View set or delete alliance or guild google sheets

info.desc: Configure any alliance or guild settings

key.name: key
key.desc: The setting to change or view

value.name: value
value.desc: The value to set the setting to

delete.desc: Delete an alliance or guild setting

remove.desc:
Remove a role to a user
See: `/self list`

list.desc: List the self roles that you can assign yourself via the bot

create.desc: Allow a role to add/remove roles from users

requireRole.name: requireRole
requireRole.desc: Require this role in order to use the specified self roles

add.desc:
Add discord role to a user
See: `/self list`

legacy_reports.desc:
Import the legacy sheet of reports from a google sheet
Expects the columns: `Discord ID`, `Nation ID`, `Reason`, `Reporting Entity`

unban.desc: Remove a ban on a nation submitting new reports

show.desc: View a report and its comments

generate.desc: Generate a sheet of all the community reports for players

search.desc: List all reports about or submitted by a nation or user

remove.desc: Remove a report of a nation or user

purge.desc: Mass delete reports about or submitted by a user or nation

upload.desc:
Import loan report data from a google sheet
Expects the columns: Receiver, Principal, Remaining, Status, Due Date, Loan Date, Paid, Interest
This is not affect member balances and is solely for sharing information with the public

update_all.desc:
Mark all active loans by this guild as up to date
It is useful for loan reporting to remain accurate

update.desc:
Update a loan for a nation or alliance
If no other arguments are provided, only the last updated date will be set

sheet.desc:
Generate a google sheet of all loan information banks and alliances have submitted
If no nations are provided, only the loans for this server are returned
If no loan status is provided, all loans are returned

remove.desc:
Delete a loan for a nation or alliance
Note: To delete all loans use the loan purge command

guildOrAllianceId.name: guildOrAllianceId
guildOrAllianceId.desc: Purge all loans created by this guild or alliance id

add.desc: Add a loan for a nation or alliance

purge.desc: Mass delete reports about or submitted by a user or nation

delete.desc: Remove a comment on a report

add.desc: Add a short comment to a report

ban.desc:
Ban a nation from submitting new reports
Reports they have already submitted will remain
Use the purge command to delete existing reports

approve.desc: Approv a report for a nation or user

analyze.desc: Show an analysis of a nation's risk factors including: Reports, loans, discord & game bans, money trades and proximity with blacklisted nations, multi info, user account age, inactivity predictors

add.desc:
Report a nation or user's game behavior to the bot for things such as fraud
Note: Submitting spam or maliciously false reports may result in being locked out of reporting commands

register.desc: Register your discord user with your Politics And War nation.

slots.desc: Check how many projects slots a nation has

sheet.desc: Sheet of projects each nation has

costsheet.desc: Generate csv file of project costs

cost.desc: Shows the cost of a project

unlocktransfers.desc:
Unlock transfers for an alliance or guild using this guild as an offshore
Accounts are automatically locked if there is an error accessing the api, a game captcha, or if an admin of the account is banned in-game
Only locks from game bans persist across restarts

send.desc:
Send the funds in the alliance bank to an alliance added to the `offshore` coalition in the bot
Optionally specify warchest and offshoring account

to.name: to
to.desc:
Specify an alternative Offshore alliance to send funds in-game to
Defaults to the currently set offshore coalition

account.name: account
account.desc:
Specify an alternative account to offshore with
Defaults to the sender alliance

keepAmount.name: keepAmount
keepAmount.desc:
The amount of resources to keep in the bank
Defaults to keep nothing

sendAmount.name: sendAmount
sendAmount.desc:
Specify specific resource amounts to offshore
Defaults to all resources
The send amount is auto capped by the resources available and `keepAmount`

markasoffshore.desc:
Mark an alliance as the offshore of another
This is solely for informational purposes such as when displaying an alliance's info or militarization

prolific.desc: List potential offshore alliances by the value of their bank transfers to nations over a period of time

for_enemies.desc:
Return potential offshores for a list of enemy alliances
If allies are specified, only offshores that are not allied with any of the allies will be returned

for_coalition.desc: Find potential offshores used by an alliance

add.desc:
Set the bot managed offshore for this guild
The alliance must use a guild with locutus settings `ALLIANCE_ID` and `API_KEY` set, and the coalitions `offshore` and `offshoring` set to include the offshore alliance

accountsheet.desc: Compare the stockpile in the offshore alliance in-game bank to the total account balances of all offshoring alliances/guilds

create.desc:
Create a discord modal for a bot command
This will make a popup prompting for the command arguments you specify and submit any defaults you provide
Note: This is intended to be used in conjuction with the card command

arguments.name: arguments
arguments.desc: A comma separated list of the command arguments to prompt for

defaults.name: defaults
defaults.desc:
The default arguments and values you want to submit to the command
Example: `myarg1:myvalue1 myarg2:myvalue2`

me.desc: Get info about your own nation

targets.desc:
Send spy or war blitz sheets to individual nations
Blitz Sheet Columns: `nation`, `attacker 1`, `attacker 2`, `attacker 3`

blitzSheet.name: blitzSheet
blitzSheet.desc: Url of the war blitz sheet to send

spySheet.name: spySheet
spySheet.desc: Url of the spy sheet to send

allowedNations.name: allowedNations
allowedNations.desc: What attacker nations to send to

allowedEnemies.name: allowedEnemies
allowedEnemies.desc: What defender nations to include (default: all)

header.name: header
header.desc: Text to prepend to the target instructions being sent

sendFromGuildAccount.name: sendFromGuildAccount
sendFromGuildAccount.desc: Send from the api key registered to the guild

apiKey.name: apiKey
apiKey.desc: The api key to use to send the mail

hideDefaultBlurb.name: hideDefaultBlurb
hideDefaultBlurb.desc: Hide the default blurb from the message

useLeader.name: useLeader
useLeader.desc: Parse nation leader instead of nation name

dm.name: dm
dm.desc: Send instructions as direct message on discord

sheet.desc:
Bulk send in-game mail from a google sheet
Columns: `nation`, `subject`, `body`
Other bulk mail commands forward to this command

send.desc:
Send in-game mail to a list of nations
Supports subject and body nation placeholders
See: <https://github.com/xdnw/locutus/wiki/nation_placeholders>
Append the channel id to the subject to direct responses there:
`Hello Nation/12345678910`
(Note: DM Borg to setup mail responses)

sendFromGuildAccount.name: sendFromGuildAccount
sendFromGuildAccount.desc: Send from the api key registered to the guild

apiKey.name: apiKey
apiKey.desc: The api key to use to send the mail

search.desc:
Show ingame mail and optionally the responses
Results are in a spreadsheet
A search term can be specified to only show messages containing that in the subject line
By default only unread messages are checked

account.name: account
account.desc:
The account to check the mail of
Defaults to your own nation

search_for.name: search_for
search_for.desc:
The term to search for
Defaults to show all messages

skip_unread.name: skip_unread
skip_unread.desc:
Don't search unread messages
Defaults to false

group_by_nation.name: group_by_nation
group_by_nation.desc: If responses are grouped by nation

reply.desc:
Reply to an in-game mail message
Supports subject and body nation placeholders

create.desc: Create a simple embed with a title and description

commands.desc:
Generate a card which runs a command when users react to it.
Put commands inside "quotes".
Prefix a command with a #channel e.g. `"#channel /embedcommand"` to have the command output go there

Prefix the command with:`~/command` to remove the user's reaction upon use and keep the card
`_/command` to remove ALL reactions upon use and keep the card
`./command` to keep the card upon use

Example:
`/embed 'Some Title' 'My First Embed' '~/fun say Hello {nation}' '/fun say "Goodbye {nation}"'`

raw.desc:
Add a button to a discord embed from this bot which runs a command
Supports legacy commands and user command syntax.
Unlike `embed add button`, this does not parse and validate command input.

modal.desc: Add a modal button to a discord embed from this bot, which creates a prompt for a command

cost.desc: Calculate the costs of purchasing cities (from current to max)

Use provider list command to view types.

resume.desc:
Resume paused chat provider (i.e. manual/error).
Check provider status with list command.

pause.desc:
Pause a chat provider.
Other providers will not be paused.
Halts document conversion using this provider.
Providers may be resumed.

list.desc:
List available chat providers, and their information.
This includes status, rate limits, execution time, model, permissions, options.

configure.desc:
Customize options for a chat provider.
Defaults apply if not set.
Configurations for all new messages.
Refer to API docs for details: <https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/chat/create>

view.desc:
Save Google spreadsheet contents to a named embedding dataset.
Requires two columns labeled "fact" or "question" and "answer" for vectors.
Search finds nearest fact, or searches questions and returns corresponding answers if two columns.

select.desc: Set the data sources you want to use to generate natural language responses for chat queries

list.desc:
This command provides a list of accessible embedding datasets used for prompting GPT.
Embedding datasets consist of vectors representing text strings, allowing for comparison between different strings.
See: <https://github.com/xdnw/locutus/wiki> or <https://politicsandwar.fandom.com/wiki/Politics_and_War_Wiki>
To view a specific dataset see: /chat embedding view

import_sheet.desc:
Save Google spreadsheet contents to a named embedding dataset.
Requires two columns labeled "fact" or "question" and "answer" for vectors.
Search finds nearest fact, or searches questions and returns corresponding answers if two columns.

delete.desc:
Delete your custom datasets.
Default datasets cannot be deleted, and if a custom dataset is deleted, tasks will fall back to using the base datasets.

resume.desc: Resume conversion for a google document to a chat dataset

pause.desc:
Pause conversion for a google document to a chat dataset
Conversion can be resumed later

list.desc:
Show the documents currently converting to a dataset
Datasets are a list of information that can be used to generate chat responses

delete.desc: Delete a conversion task for a google document to a chat dataset

add_document.desc:
Convert a public Google document (of document type) into a Google spreadsheet of facts.
The output format will have a single column with a header row labeled "facts." Each fact will be standalone and not order dependent.
The information is extracted using the user's configured GPT provider.
When the command is run, the document is added to the queue, and the user will be alerted when the conversion finishes.
Users have the option to check the progress of the conversion using a command.
